text: We also said that when we use SER or ESTAR with an adjective plus QUE, so for example ES RELEVANTE QUE, it's relevant that, ESTÁ BIEN QUE, it's okay that.

text: We will follow this up with the mood tense.

text: So how is it's not very relevant?

text: NO ES MUY RELEVANTE.

text: So here we're not starting with the past, are we?

text: NO ES MUY RELEVANTE, that's the present.

text: But after QUE we refer back to the past, so we can use the past mood tense.

text: But we can remember the word ERA in English to remember this line in the past from SER.

text: So we want to identify the structures that allow us to use the mood tense, other than to use the mood tense correctly, to also avoid it sometimes.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: No?
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So imagine you're having a conversation and you just want to get the meaning across and the point across, and maybe you don't want to worry in that moment about finding the mood tense.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: You just have something you need to say, and you will worry about it later, how it would be with the mood tense.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So we can play around with the structure as we did, for example, with VOLVÍ A LLAMARTE PARA ORGANIZAR.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: I called you again to organize instead of VOLVÍ A LLAMARTE PARA QUE ORGANIZÁRAMOS.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: I called you again so that we organized.

text: Like we did there, we can play around a little bit with the structure to avoid using the mood tense.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So for example, instead of saying ES IMPORTANTE QUE, we could also say THE IMPORTANT THING IS THAT.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: And when we say THE IMPORTANT THING IS THAT, what we end up with is ES QUE.

text: So we said that we have a useful structure that we can use to give this the important thing.

text: Yes, LO IMPORTANTE.

text: Good.
speaker: Speaker 1

text: So we said that instead of saying literally THE IMPORTANT THING, you can just use LO with any adjective and you get this idea of THE IMPORTANT THING.
